comments:
Using M20050907-1200,
I got this exception running some tests.

Exception in thread "Java indexing" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 8
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.HashMapOfString.get(HashMapOfString.java:59)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.EclipsePreferences.internalGet(EclipsePreferences.java:520)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.EclipsePreferences.get(EclipsePreferences.java:363)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.PreferencesService.get(PreferencesService.java:444)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaModelManager.getOptions(JavaModelManager.java:1181)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.core.JavaCore.getOptions(JavaCore.java:2401)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaProject.getOptions(JavaProject.java:1553)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.indexing.SourceIndexer.indexDocument(SourceIndexer.java:55)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.JavaSearchParticipant.indexDocument(JavaSearchParticipant.java:72)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.indexing.IndexManager.indexDocument(IndexManager.java:290)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.indexing.IndexManager$1.execute(IndexManager.java:601)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.processing.JobManager.run(JobManager.java:372)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:595)

It is not 100% reproducible so I guess it could be due to some racing conditions.

Thanks Olivier. John and I looked at this (since he's the concurrency expert :-)
and I have released the attached code to HEAD.
